features.name: Routing & Screens
features.description: App routing and page structure using `expo-router`. Contains nested route groups and many screens for analytics, auth, inventory, orders, product-details, tabs, and more.

features.name: API / Services
features.description: API wrappers, service modules and helpers that call backend endpoints (axios instance, caching, authentication helpers, product/order/customer services).

features.name: Components
features.description: Shared UI components (buttons, inputs, charts, modals, date pickers, sidebar, etc). Reused across screens.

features.name: State Management / Stores
features.description: Lightweight stores using Zustand and some custom onboarding & user stores.

features.name: Types & Validation
features.description: Type definitions and validation schemas for forms and API payloads.

features.name: Assets & Fonts
features.description: Project assets including fonts and images used by the app and web build.

features.name: Scripts & Tooling
features.description: Project scripts and configuration (expo start scripts, linting, TypeScript config).

features.name: Payments
features.description: Stripe integration and payment helpers used in client/service modules and screens.

features.name: Web target (Expo web)
features.description: Expo configured to run on web via `expo start --web`. Default web dev port is 19006 (expo web).

notes.recommended_start: Use `npm run web` or `expo start --web` to run the app on web so TestSprite can access it.
